message.content:
cs.DC, cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with distributed computation, specifically in the context of machine learning, and proposes a scheme based on coding theory to mitigate the effects of stragglers. This makes it likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) category. Additionally, the paper deals with optimization of the scheme parameters to minimize expected waiting time, which could place it in the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) category. The use of gradient descent and machine learning also makes it likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) category. The paper also mentions the use of Reed Solomon codes, which is a topic in Information Theory (cs.IT), and the theoretical delay model could place it in the Systems and Control (cs.SY) category.
